Prompt.pre_question_prompt: I am an expert in fire hazard statistics. I will ask some questions to collect information and then I will use the information to create a statistics report on fire hazard.
Prompt.task_specific_prompt: Write a statistics report on fire hazard using the questions and answers above.

QApair.Question: How many times did you use a stovetop or oven to cook in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I used a stovetop or oven to cook approximately 4-6 times per week.

QApair.Question: How many times did you leave the stovetop or oven unattended while cooking in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I left the stovetop or oven unattended while cooking approximately 10 times per week.

QApair.Question: How many times did you forget to extinguish a candle in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I forgot to extinguish a candle approximately 8-9 times per week.

QApair.Question: How many times did you smoke cigarettes in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I smoked cigarettes approximately 0-1 times per week.

QApair.Question: How many times did you fall asleep with the television on in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I fell asleep with the television on approximately 2-3 times per week.

QApair.Question: How many times did you leave the house without ensuring that all appliances were turned off in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I left the house without ensuring that all appliances were turned off approximately 3-4 times per week.

QApair.Question: How many electrical appliances were plugged in and turned on in your home during the day when you were not home in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I had approximately 1-2 electrical appliances plugged in and turned on in my home during the day when I was not home.

QApair.Question: How many times did you have a grease fire in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I had a grease fire approximately 5 times per week.

QApair.Question: How many times did you have a dryer fire in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I had a dryer fire approximately 1 time per week.

Instances.Output: The average home will have one fire every year, but this home had no fires in the past year. The stovetop or oven was used to cook 4-6 times per week and was left unattended while cooking 10 times per week. The homeowner forgot to extinguish candles 8-9 times per week. Cigarettes were smoked 0-1 times per week. The television was left on when falling asleep 2-3 times per week. The house was left without ensuring all appliances were turned off 3-4 times per week. 1-2 electrical appliances were plugged in and turned on during the day when the homeowner was not home. There were 5 grease fires and 1 dryer fire per week.

QApair.Question: How many times did you leave the stovetop or oven unattended while cooking in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I left the stovetop or oven unattended while cooking approximately 10 times per week.

QApair.Question: How many times did you forget to extinguish a candle in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I do not use candles.

QApair.Question: How many times did you smoke cigarettes in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I smoked cigarettes approximately 0-1 times per week.

QApair.Question: How many times did you fall asleep with the television on in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I fell asleep with the television on approximately 4-5 times per week.

QApair.Question: How many times did you leave the house without ensuring that all appliances were turned off in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I never ensure if all the appliances are turned off before leaving.

QApair.Question: How many electrical appliances were plugged in and turned on in your home during the day when you were not home in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I had approximately 6-7 electrical appliances plugged in ,but 2 of them were turned on in my home during the day when I was not home.

QApair.Question: How many times did you have a house party in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I had 1-2 house parties in the past year.

QApair.Question: Did you use any extension cords in your home in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I used extension cords in my home approximately 1-2 times per week.

QApair.Question: Did you overload any outlets in your home in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I overloaded outlets in my home approximately 1-2 times per week.

QApair.Question: Did you use any space heaters in your home in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I used space heaters in my home approximately 1-2 times per week.

Instances.Output: Based on the answers given, it is estimated that the home had 1 fire in the past year. The stovetop or oven was used to cook approximately 7 times per week and was left unattended while cooking approximately 10 times per week. There were no candles used in the home, and cigarettes were smoked 0-1 times per week. The television was left on and the respondent fell asleep in front of it 4-5 times per week. The respondent never ensured that all appliances were turned off before leaving the house. 6-7 electrical appliances were plugged in and turned on in the home during the day when the respondent was not home. 1-2 house parties were held in the past year, and extension cords were used in the home 1-2 times per week. Outlets were overloaded 1-2 times per week, and space heaters were used 1-2 times per week.

QApair.Question: How many fires occurred in your home in the past year?
QApair.Answer: There were 10 fire in my home in the past year.

QApair.Question: What were the causes of the fires?
QApair.Answer: The causes of the fire were: 1. Cooking 2. Smoking 3. Electrical 4. Candles 5. Heating

QApair.Question: How many people were injured in the fires?
QApair.Answer: There were three people injured in the fires.

QApair.Question: How much damage was caused by the fires?
QApair.Answer: The fires caused $10,000 in damage.

QApair.Question: What is the value of your home?
QApair.Answer: The value of my home is $100,000.

QApair.Question: What is the occupancy of your home?
QApair.Answer: The occupancy of my home is four people.

QApair.Question: What is the age of your home?
QApair.Answer: My home is 50 years old.

QApair.Question: What is the height of your home?
QApair.Answer: My home is two stories.

QApair.Question: What is the size of your home?
QApair.Answer: My home is 1,000 square feet.

QApair.Question: What is the type of construction of your home?
QApair.Answer: My home is frame construction.

Instances.Output: According to the National Fire Protection Association, the leading cause of home fires is cooking. In the past year, there have been 10 fires in the home, three of which were caused by cooking. These fires have caused $10,000 in damage and three people have been injured.The value of the home is $100,000 and it is 50 years old. The home is two stories and 1,000 square feet. The type of construction is frame construction. The occupancy of the home is four people.Based on the information above, the home is at a moderate risk for fire. The leading cause of home fires is cooking, so it is important to be vigilant when cooking. Electrical and smoking are also leading causes of home fires, so it is important to make sure that electrical appliances are in good working order and that smoking is only done outside.
